item.title: Understanding Coupling in Software Design
item.description: What is Coupling? Link to heading Imagine you have two software components, A and B. In the worst-case scenario of tight coupling, changing one component unexpectedly affects the other, even if they don’t directly collaborate. This interdependence creates a tangled mess, making modifications difficult and prone to errors. However, software often thrives on collaboration. This is where loose coupling comes into play. Loose coupling promotes independence between components. They can function with minimal reliance on each other’s internal workings.
